engine.mechanic: Roll d6s equal to Action Rating. If 0 dice, roll 2d6 and take lowest. Read the single highest die result.
engine.success: 6 = Full Success (you do it). 4-5 = Partial Success (you do it, but with consequence or reduced effect). 1-3 = Bad Outcome (things go wrong).
engine.crit: Multiple 6s = Critical Success (enhanced effect or additional benefit)

procedures.action:
The core action resolution:
1. Player declares goal and approach
2. GM sets Position (Controlled/Risky/Desperate) based on danger
3. GM sets Effect (Limited/Standard/Great) based on approach potency
4. Player rolls Action Rating in d6s
5. Read highest die: 6=Success, 4-5=Partial, 1-3=Failure
6. GM describes outcome
7. On Partial/Failure: GM inflicts consequences based on Position
8. Player may Resist any consequence (roll Attribute, take stress equal to 6 minus highest)
procedures.score:
Running a criminal operation:
1. Engagement Roll: GM rolls dice based on plan quality, determines starting Position
2. Play through the score scene by scene
3. Use Flashbacks for preparation (0-2 stress based on complexity)
4. Complete the objective or abort
5. After: Payoff, Heat, Entanglements, Downtime
procedures.downtime:
Between scores, each PC gets 2 Downtime Activities:
1. Acquire Asset: Get an item or service (roll tier)
2. Long-term Project: Advance a clock
3. Recover: Heal harm (roll tier, 1-2: heal 1, 3-4: heal 2, 5-6: heal 3, crit: heal all)
4. Reduce Heat: Lower the crew's wanted level
5. Train: Mark XP in Attribute or Playbook
6. Indulge Vice: Roll lowest Attribute, clear that much Stress. If clear more than track, Overindulge.
procedures.combat:
Combat follows the standard action roll:
1. There is no initiative - fiction determines who acts
2. Group actions: One person leads, others assist (+1d per helper who takes stress on failure)
3. Harm levels: Level 1 (Less Severe), Level 2 (Moderate), Level 3 (Severe, requires medical attention)
4. Armor can absorb harm (special armor absorbs any one consequence per score)
5. Death only at Level 3 harm + additional Level 3 harm, or narrative circumstances

fields.label: Hunt
fields.usage_hint: Track, ambush, attack from hiding, snipe.

fields.label: Study
fields.usage_hint: Research, analyze, scrutinize details, understand mechanisms.

fields.label: Survey
fields.usage_hint: Observe, search, spot trouble, gather information.

fields.label: Tinker
fields.usage_hint: Create, repair, disable, modify devices and mechanisms.

fields.label: Finesse
fields.usage_hint: Precise movement, sleight of hand, subtle misdirection, pilot vehicles.

fields.label: Prowl
fields.usage_hint: Move stealthily, hide, infiltrate, ambush.

fields.label: Skirmish
fields.usage_hint: Fight in close quarters, melee combat, brawl.

fields.label: Wreck
fields.usage_hint: Destroy, smash, overpower, unleash force.

fields.label: Attune
fields.usage_hint: Connect with the ghost field, sense supernatural, use electroplasmic devices.

fields.label: Command
fields.usage_hint: Lead, order, intimidate, compel obedience.

fields.label: Consort
fields.usage_hint: Socialize, blend in, gain access, make connections.

fields.label: Sway
fields.usage_hint: Influence, manipulate, deceive, seduce.

fields.label: Insight
fields.usage_hint: Derived from Hunt, Study, Survey, Tinker. Used to resist mental consequences.

fields.label: Prowess
fields.usage_hint: Derived from Finesse, Prowl, Skirmish, Wreck. Used to resist physical consequences.

fields.label: Resolve
fields.usage_hint: Derived from Attune, Command, Consort, Sway. Used to resist social/willpower consequences.

fields.label: Stress
fields.threshold_hint: When all 9 boxes filled: Take a Trauma, clear all Stress. Stress is gained from pushing, resisting, and helping.

fields.label: Trauma
fields.threshold_hint: At 4 Trauma: Character retires from play. Each Trauma is a permanent condition (Cold, Haunted, Obsessed, Paranoid, Reckless, Soft, Unstable, Vicious).

fields.label: Level 3 Harm
fields.threshold_hint: Severe harm (broken leg, stabbed gut). Need to be Disabled, Dying, or similar. Requires medical attention. -1d to all actions.

fields.label: Level 2 Harm
fields.threshold_hint: Moderate harm (exhausted, deep cut, concussed). -1d to related actions.

fields.label: Level 1 Harm
fields.threshold_hint: Lesser harm (battered, drained, distracted). Reduced effect on related actions.

fields.label: Healing Clock
fields.usage_hint: Fill during downtime recovery. When full, reduce each harm by one level.

fields.label: Armor
fields.usage_hint: Can be used once per score to resist physical harm.

fields.label: Heavy Armor
fields.usage_hint: Additional armor use, but conspicuous and noisy.

fields.label: Special Armor
fields.usage_hint: Playbook-specific. Can resist one specific type of consequence per score.

fields.label: Playbook XP
fields.threshold_hint: At 8: Clear and take a playbook advance.

fields.label: Insight XP
fields.threshold_hint: At 6: Clear and add 1 dot to an Insight action.

fields.label: Prowess XP
fields.threshold_hint: At 6: Clear and add 1 dot to a Prowess action.

fields.label: Resolve XP
fields.threshold_hint: At 6: Clear and add 1 dot to a Resolve action.

fields.label: Special Abilities
fields.usage_hint: Playbook special abilities.

fields.label: Loadout
fields.usage_hint: Light (3), Normal (5), Heavy (6). Chosen at score start. Items marked as carried count against this.

fields.label: Items
fields.usage_hint: Standard items cost 1 load. Check off when you use them during a score.

fields.label: Vice
fields.usage_hint: Faith, Gambling, Luxury, Obligation, Pleasure, Stupor, Weird. Indulge to clear stress.

fields.label: Trauma Conditions
fields.usage_hint: Cold, Haunted, Obsessed, Paranoid, Reckless, Soft, Unstable, Vicious.
